meanings.definition: To increase the power or efficiency of (something) by adding a turbocharger.
meanings.sent1: I will turbocharge my car to make it faster.
meanings.sent2: Adding a turbocharger can turbocharge the engine's performance.
meanings.sent3: I tried to turbocharge my bicycle with a turbocharger, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm turbocharged the team's motivation to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The new software update will turbocharge your computer's speed.

meanings.definition: To make something happen or progress faster or more effectively.
meanings.sent1: Let's turbocharge our study session to finish early.
meanings.sent2: A good night's sleep can turbocharge your productivity the next day.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could turbocharge time to get to the weekend sooner.
meanings.sent4: The caffeine in coffee can turbocharge your energy levels.
meanings.sent5: Listening to upbeat music can turbocharge your workout.
